text: Andrea Alföldi (born September 22, 1964 in Komló, Baranya) is a retired female race walker from Hungary, who competed for her native country at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona, Spain. She set her personal best (43.41) in the women's 10 km event in 1992. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1989 |World Indoor Championships |Budapest, Hungary |6th |3000 m |12:31.66 |- |World Race Walking Cup |L'Hospitalet, Spain |22nd |10 km |46:43 |- |rowspan=3|1991 |World Race Walking Cup |San Jose, United States |11th |10 km |45:42 |- |Universiade |Sheffield, United Kingdom |8th |10 km |46:41 |- |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |14th |10 km |45:22 |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |18th |10 km |46:35 |- |rowspan=2|1993 |World Race Walking Cup |Monterrey, Mexico |19th |10 km |47:59 |- |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |14th |10 km |45:57 |- |1995 |World Race Walking Cup |Beijing, PR China |61st |10 km |48:20 |} ==References== ==External links== * * * * Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Hungarian female racewalkers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Hungary Category:People from Komló Category:Competitors at the 1991 Summer Universiade
title: Andrea Alföldi
